pullsbody:
Fixes #33


As of January 1 2019, Mozilla requires that all GitHub projects include this [CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md](https://github.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) file in the project root. The file has two parts:

1. Required Text - All text under the headings *Community Participation Guidelines and How to Report*, are required, and should not be altered.
2. Optional Text - The Project Specific Etiquette heading provides a space to speak more specifically about ways people can work effectively and inclusively together. Some examples of those can be found on the [Firefox Debugger](https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) project, and [Common Voice](https://github.com/mozilla/voice-web/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). (The optional part is commented out in the [raw template file](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md), and will not be visible until you modify and uncomment that part.)

If you have any questions about this file, or Code of Conduct policies and procedures, please see [Mozilla-GitHub-Standards](https://wiki.mozilla.org/GitHub/Repository_Requirements) or email Mozilla-GitHub-Standards+CoC@mozilla.com.

_(Message COC002)_
pull_commit_message:
Add Mozilla Code of Conduct file

Fixes #33.

_(Message COC002)_
changing to hashrouter for now

pulltitle: Expose WebAssembly Studio forks as `module=` search params on the code screen
pullsbody: WebAssembly Studio sends a `postMessage` to the embedding page when the project is forked. This PR adds code to update the location to include the fork's ID and passes the ID in when loading WebAssembly Studio is loaded.
pull_commit_message:
Expose WebAssembly Studio forks as `module=` search params on the code screen

WebAssembly Studio sends a postMessage to the embedding page when the project is forked. This PR adds code to update the location to include the fork's ID and passes the ID in when loading WebAssembly Studio is loaded.

pulltitle: Rotate frame data received from WebAssembly Studio by 180 degrees
pullsbody:
The mapping of pixels to the Arch is highly unintuitive, and we want to avoid exposing this to users. The mapping is much easier to reason about if the pixels are rotated by 180 degrees, i.e. if the first pixel becomes the last, and vice versa.

The previewer has the inverse mapping, so to keep that the way it should be, we just rotate the 3D model by 180 degrees.
pull_commit_message:
Rotate frame data received from WebAssembly Studio by 180 degrees

The mapping of pixels to the Arch is highly unintuitive, and we want to avoid exposing this to users. The mapping is much easier to reason about if the pixels are rotated by 180 degrees, i.e. if the first pixel becomes the last, and vice versa.

The previewer has the inverse mapping, so to keep that the way it should be, we just rotate the 3D model by 180 degrees.
Fix sorting bug

pulltitle: Simplify the format of animations as received by WebAssembly Studio
pullsbody:
Currently animations are encoded to JSON by WebAssembly Studio and then immediately decoded into ImageData objects by the website. This patch changes the website to expect a single ArrayBuffer containing the entire animation, which is what WebAssembly Studio uses internally.

On the WebAssembly Studio side the new format can be sent with a simple template change.

The patch also removes the rotation of incoming frames, as we can adapt the templates to not need that. In fact that's much better because otherwise the mental model for how to map pixels to the Arch is more difficult.
pull_commit_message:
Simplify the format of animations as received by WebAssembly Studio

Currently animations are encoded to JSON by WebAssembly Studio and then immediately decoded into ImageData objects by the website. This patch changes the website to expect a single ArrayBuffer containing the entire animation, which is what WebAssembly Studio uses internally.

On the WebAssembly Studio side the new format can be sent with a simple template change.

The patch also removes the rotation of incoming frames, as we can adapt the templates to not need that. In fact that's much better because otherwise the mental model for how to map pixels to the Arch is more difficult.
